name: One Use Spaceships
description:
This is a prototype game, created for VR Jam 2022, with a single gameplay loop: Walk around on a planet (with simulated spherical gravity, so you can actually walk "around" each planet in about 30 seconds!), find a broken-down ship, fly to the next planet, and repeat 5 times.  Do that as fast as you can.  Time is tracked on your left wrist, and the number of planets visited is tracked on your right wrist.

It takes about 5 to 10 minutes to complete each run of the time trial. You must remember which planets you have already visited, otherwise it will take longer.

Set your expectations: this was created for a Game Jam, so it is a prototype of a single gameplay loop.  I know the lighting, textures, fog, and many other things need lots of polish. Also, this is basically a single level Time Trial, so re-playability is limited, but it is a tech demo of the core gameplay mechanic.

Works with PC VR on Windows, tested with Quest 2 via Air Link and Valve Index with Index Controllers. It may work with Vive wands (using the touchpad in place of thumb sticks), but I could not test that.  It uses OpenXR, so it will use the default OpenXR runtime on your system (either Oculus or SteamVR or something else).  All the assets are low-poly, so it should run on low-end VR-capable PCs.  I did not have the time to get a native Quest 2 port working, and I did not have the time to get teleport working (so smooth locomotion is the only option, sorry about that!).
